text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron beesianum (宽钟杜鹃) is a rhododendron species native to northeastern Myanmar, southeastern Tibet, and southwestern Sichuan and northwestern Yunnan in China, where it grows at altitudes of 3200–4500 meters. It is a shrub or small tree that grows to 2–9 meters in height, with leathery leaves that are oblanceolate to oblong-lanceolate, and 10–25 × 3–7 cm in size. Flowers are pinkish white to pink.
text.References:
Diels, Notes Roy. Bot. Gard. Edinburgh. 5: 214. 1912.
